content.text: Position papers will be graded based on 4 different criteria: Knowledge of Topic, Knowledge of Position, Potential Solutions, and Sources. Each category is worth 10 points for a total of 40 points. See the table below for exact grading guidelines.

A score of 10 on Knowledge of Topic, Knowledge of Position, and Potential Solutions is based on demonstrating an in-depth understanding of the issue at hand and providing inventive, unique insights that go beyond restating information already given.

For a 10 on Sources, the position paper must contain accurate in-text citations and the consistent use of strong, credible, and reliable sources throughout. Grade JUST on the sources themselves, not the formatting of the page.
When giving feedback, make sure to output how many points were earned for each section of the rubric.
